bill_title: allow the use of dogs in tracking wounded deer.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow the use of dogs in tracking wounded deer. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 41-8-15 be amended to read as follows: 41-8-15. Except in the hunting of mountain lions during established hunting seasons, no dog may be used in hunting big game animals. However, dogs that are kept on a leash under the control of the owner or handler may be used to track or locate a wounded deer. No person involved in the tracking and locating of the deer may possess a firearm or bow and arrow unless the person possesses a valid and unfilled deer license or tag for the involved area. Possession of the firearm or bow and arrow is permitted only during the period of time from one-half hour before sunrise until one-half hour after sunset. A violation of this section is subject to § 41-8-18. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
